TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi Manager extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.IE.IHostEx

Docs.summary: Provides methods for enabling managed code to execute as an ActiveX control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Manager class initializes the properties that enable managed code to execute as an ActiveX control in a sandboxed application domain.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string CanonizeURL (string pURL, Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS flags);
.method public static hidebysig string CanonizeURL(string pURL, valuetype Microsoft.IE.Manager/URL_CANONFLAGS flags) cil managed
Public Shared Function CanonizeURL (pURL As String, flags As Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS) As String
public: static System::String ^ CanonizeURL(System::String ^ pURL, Microsoft::IE::Manager::URL_CANONFLAGS flags);
static member CanonizeURL : string * Microsoft.IE.Manager.URL_CANONFLAGS -> string

Docs.param: A null-terminated string of maximum length () that contains a URL string. If the string does not refer to a file, it must include a valid scheme such as "http://".

The flags that specify how the URL will be converted to canonical form. The following flags can be combined:
- : Treat "/./" and "/../" in a URL string as literal characters, not as shorthand for navigation.
- : Convert any occurrence of "%" to its escape sequence.
- : Replace only spaces with escape sequences. This flag takes precedence over , but does not apply to opaque URLs.
- : Replace unsafe characters with their escape sequences. Unsafe characters are characters that may be altered during transport across the Internet. They include the <, >, ", #, {, }, |, \\, ^, [, ], and ' characters. This flag applies to all URLs, including opaque URLs.
- : Defined to be the same as .
- : Combine URLs with client-defined pluggable protocols, according to the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification. This flag does not apply to standard protocols such as FTP, HTTP, and Gopher. If this flag is set, there is no need to also set .
- : Unescape any escape sequences that the URLs contain, with two exceptions. The escape sequences for "?" and "#" are not unescaped. If one of the URL_ESCAPE flags is also set, the two URLs are first unescaped, and then combined, and then escaped.
Docs.summary: Converts a URL string into canonical form.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.IE.ISecureFactory GetSecuredClassFactory(int32 flags, int32 zone, string site, string uniqueIdString, string fileHashString, string typeName, string assemblyName) cil managed

Public Overridable Function GetSecuredClassFactory (flags As Integer, zone As Integer, site As String, uniqueIdString As String, fileHashString As String, typeName As String, assemblyName As String) As ISecureFactory

public: virtual Microsoft::IE::ISecureFactory ^ GetSecuredClassFactory(int flags, int zone, System::String ^ site, System::String ^ uniqueIdString, System::String ^ fileHashString, System::String ^ typeName, System::String ^ assemblyName);

abstract member GetSecuredClassFactory : int * int * string * string * string * string * string -> Microsoft.IE.ISecureFactory override this.GetSecuredClassFactory : int * int * string * string * string * string * string -> Microsoft.IE.ISecureFactory
MemberSignature.Usage: manager.GetSecuredClassFactory (flags, zone, site, uniqueIdString, fileHashString, typeName, assemblyName)

Docs.param:
One of the following CORIESECURITY values:
- CORIESECURITY_ZONE: 0x01
- CORIESECURITY_SITE: 0x02

One of the following URLZONE values:
- URLZONE_LOCAL_MACHINE: 0x00
- URLZONE_INTRANET: 0x01
- URLZONE_TRUSTED: 0x02
- URLZONE_INTERNET: 0x03
- URLZONE_UNTRUSTED: 0x04
The site address.
A unique ID for the site.
The hexadecimal encoded hash value of the assembly that is being loaded.
The name of the assembly.
The name of the type.
Docs.summary:
Creates a class factory that provides security information about the assembly.
This API is not CLS-compliant.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the secure class factory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, most of the parameter values can be obtained from the Internet Security Manager.
